abstract: News Analysis; German Chancellor Angela Merkel discreetly moves to reduce flow of migrants into Germany, while formally maintaining policy of openness; leader's falling approval ratings, and rise of right-wing parties, has forced her to make compromises, such as seeking Turkey's help despite deep misgivings about its human rights abuses.
lead_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel, who has rejected all requests to limit the influx of newcomers, maintains that it would be a “gigantic mistake” if Germans did not welcome refugees.

headline.main: Merkel, While Refusing to Halt Migrant Influx, Works to Limit It
headline.print_headline: Merkel, While Refusing to Halt Migrant Influx, Works to Limit It

snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel, who has rejected all requests to limit the influx of newcomers, maintains that it would be a “gigantic mistake” if Germans did not welcome refugees.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
